特記事項:
この科目は、4/28（木）までの授業がオンデマンドで実施される科目です。
5/2（月）以降の授業は対面での実施が決定しました。本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course will be offered on-demand until Thursday, April 28.
Classes will be held in a face-to-face format from Monday, May 2 onward.
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
IMPORTANT NOTICE: This course is conducted in lecture format. Please note the following in light of the ongoing pandemic: assignments will be posted on LUNA throughout the term, along with important announcements about the course -- including which lectures are in person and which are online -- and so it is critical that students log in to LUNA regularly during this course.

* This course will be offered on-demand until Thursday, April 28. After the course registration is finalized, students will be notified of the course implementation format from Friday, April 29 onward.*

第1回:
April 8th: Introduction: Course Overview, Key Concepts
No Assignment Due
This lecture is in "On-Demand Format" only. (There is no face-to-face lecture for this week. URL for this video lecture will be posted here in April.)
第2回:
April 15th: Rome’s Shadow: The Legacy of Ancient Rome in Europe Part I
No Assignment Due
This lecture is in "On-Demand Format" only. (There is no face-to-face lecture for this week. URL for this video lecture will be posted here in April.)
第3回:
April 22nd: Rome’s Shadow: The Legacy of Ancient Rome in Europe Part II
No Written Assignment Due. Reading Assignment: de Soete pp. 87-95 (for your reference, see also: Cole and Symes 156-171)
This lecture is in "On-Demand Format" only. (There is no face-to-face lecture for this week. URL for this video lecture will be posted here in April.)
第4回:
May 6th: Westphalia: The Development of the Nation-State
No Assignment Due
From this date forward, lectures are scheduled to be in-person. (Check LUNA announcements every week to confirm each week's course format and assignment details).

評価.教科書Required texts0:
Reading assignments are from the two following sources, which are available from the SIS Library (on the Second Floor of the G Building):?
?
Francois de Soete, “From a Kingdom of Gold to One of Iron and Rust: Political Violence and the Fall of the Roman Empire,”?Kwansei Gakuin University Humanities Review?26 (2021): 87-106.

Joshua Cole and Carol Symes, Western Civilizations (20e Combined Volume).?

Each reading assignment includes a “for your reference” selection of pages, all of which are from Cole and Symes. This reading selection is not mandatory, but it can help those who would like to gain a deeper understanding of that week’s topic.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1
※kwicへのリンクとなります（在学生のみ閲覧可）
